title: Parisians finally happy? French capital's streets overflow with enthusiasm during 2024 Olympics
summary: Our reporter Florence Aubenas strolled through a capital transformed by the Olympic Games. She met tourists, volunteers, foreign journalists, chambermaids and people who didn't want to come – but ultimately did.

title: Marchand wins fifth Olympic medal as France takes bronze on medley relay
summary: China took gold, beating the United States and France to the finish.

title: Lyles wins Olympic 100m gold in closest finish in modern history: 'It's the one I wanted'
summary: Noah Lyles is the first American, male or female, to win the event since Justin Gatlin took gold in the 2004 Athens Games.

title: Paris Olympics: Safe zones set up to combat sexual and gender-based violence
summary: Prevention and reception spaces for victims and witnesses have been created in areas of festivities. These include 'safe zones,' an idea borrowed from music festivals, set up at La Villette and Hôtel de Ville. At the latter, around ten cases have been handled since July 20.

title: Emotional Mahuchikh dedicates Olympic high jump gold to slain Ukrainian athletes
summary: Yaroslava Mahuchikh said her thoughts were with the many athletes and coaches who had lost their lives in the conflict and would never be able to experience an evening as she had in Paris: 'It's really for all of them'

title: Paris 2024: The move breakdancers just can't crack
summary: Over two years and across three countries, Le Monde followed the breakers who break their teeth on a move long considered impossible.

title: Foreign police forces exchange know-how while protecting Paris Games
summary: Nearly 2,000 foreign police officers are in France to provide security for the Olympic Games.

title: Music: Devilish metal in the spotlight at the Philharmonie de Paris
summary: The capital city's music venue devotes a rich exhibition to the extreme musical genre derived from rock at 'METAL. Diabolus in musica.'

title: Martin Fourcade, five-time Olympic biathlon champion: 'The people giving parenting advice on Instagram must not have children'
summary: 'Parenting life.' A celebrity talks about the joys and trials of his daily life with children. At 35, France's most decorated Olympic athlete is retired from competition and making the most of fatherhood with his three young children. His guiding principle: 'In parenthood as in sport, there is no miracle recipe!'

title: A Mesoamerican ball game, between sport and ritual
summary: For three millennia, until it was banned by the Spanish invaders, Central American populations played 'pok-ta-pok' using a heavy rubber ball.

title: 2024 Olympics: Russians win first medal in Paris with women's tennis doubles
summary: Competing under the neutral banner, Mirra Andreeva and Diana Shnaider earned silver medals after losing in the final to Italy. Refusing to discuss politics, they focused on the sport: 'I am here to talk about tennis,' said Shnaider at a press conference.

title: Dirty Seine causes fresh suspense at Paris Olympics
summary: The men's individual race already had to be delayed by 24 hours last week because of pollution problems, before finally taking place after the women's event on Wednesday.

title: Athletics at the 2024 Olympics: The pole vaulters, an unusual brotherhood united by a touch of madness
summary: The discipline, both dangerous and spectacular, represents a unique microcosm in the world of athletics. Its practitioners praise the 'great solidarity' fostered by the nature of the competitions.

title: British PM Starmer says far-right rioters will 'regret' disorder
summary: Keir Starmer said on Sunday he could 'guarantee' that far-right rioters would 'regret' participating in violent disturbances that have spread across England in recent days.

title: Table tennis prodigy Félix Lebrun wins bronze and boosts sport's popularity in France
summary: The 17-year-old player won bronze on Sunday, beating Brazil's Hugo Calderano. France had not stood on an individual Olympic podium in this sport since 1992.

title: Paris 2024: Algeria's Nemour becomes first African gymnast to win Olympic gold
summary: Kaylia Nemour, 17, won gold on the uneven bars, in the country where she was born, raised, and trained.

title: Zelensky says Ukraine has received first F-16 jets
summary: The F-16 fighter jets that have been delivered to Ukraine by Western countries will be flying sorties in Ukrainian skies and helping the country's current fleet of Soviet-era jets to counter Russia's invasion.

title: Warren Buffett sells half of his stake in Apple
summary: The 93-year-old billionaire finds himself in charge of a huge pile of cash: $277 billion, a quarter of his assets.

title: Djokovic beats Alcaraz to win Olympic tennis gold
summary: After an almost three-hour-long match, Novak Djokovic will join Andre Agassi, Rafael Nadal, Steffi Graf and Serena Williams as the only players to win all four Grand Slam tournaments and Olympic singles gold.

title: Democrats look to reap benefits from US-Russia prisoner swap
summary: In a bid to distinguish themselves from Donald Trump, the outgoing president, Joe Biden, and the candidate to succeed him, Kamala Harris, attributed the release of the Americans held by Moscow to a diplomacy that respects allies.

title: Is France's Olympic joy only an intermission?
summary: Since the opening of the Olympic Games, the French have shown their desire to share moments together. The country seems far away from the image of a divided society given off by the European and parliamentary elections only weeks ago.

title: Paris 2024: Artistic swimming is open to men, but will take place without them
summary: For the first time in the history of the Olympic Games, the artistic swimming team events are officially mixed-gender. However, none of the 10 nations competing in them has male swimmers on its team.

title: Bangladesh riots: Almost 100 killed in deadliest day since start of protests
summary: Hundreds of thousands of protesters took to the streets on Sunday to demand Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation.

title: Paris 2024: Triathlon mixed relay gets underway in the Seine after water quality concerns
summary: Belgium's Olympic committee announced on Sunday it was withdrawing its team after one of the competitors who swam last week fell ill. It was not clear whether her illness was connected with the water in the Seine.

title: Paris Olympics: Noah Lyles wins 100 m on photo finish for first Olympic title
summary: The 27-year-old sprinter beat Jamaica's Kishane Thompson and fellow American Fred Kerley. The US hadn't won the title since the 2004 Athens Games.

title: Le Monde's Paris Olympics guide. Day 11: Beyond the Games
summary: Need a hand navigating the Olympics? Whether you're in the French capital for the sport, the culture or the food, Le Monde's English edition has got you covered with a handy guide full of practical information and secret tips.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: At 'half-time,' France has already reaped a historic medal collection
summary: After nine days of competition, the French delegation has already won 43 medals, more than in any post-war Olympic Games.

title: Bangladesh prime minister flees, protesters storm her official residence
summary: Masses of protesters demanding Sheikh Hasina's resignation roamed the streets of Dhaka. The army chief was set to address the nation.

title: 2024 US election: How is the Democratic party selecting Harris's running mate?
summary: The chosen candidate could be revealed as early as Monday, ahead of a major electoral tour starting Tuesday in Pennsylvania and Wednesday in Wisconsin, two decisive swing states.

title: UK riots: Starmer holds emergency meeting over far-right violence
summary: Several hundred people have been arrested during a series of riots organized by far-right groups since last Tuesday.

title: In Venezuela, 'Nicolas Maduro's only strategy at the moment is to hold on to power'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Venezuelan political scientist Colette Capriles says the 'democratic transition in Venezuela requires dialogue between all the political forces.'

title: Olympic tennis: Novak Djokovic crowned king of perseverance
summary: The 37-year-old Serbian tennis player won gold on Sunday against Spain's Carlos Alcaraz (7-6, 7-6), in his fifth appearance at the Games.

title: Paris 2024: The Olympics and the promise of a swimmable Seine
summary: A massive investment of €1.4 billion was made in the hopes of fulfilling an old promise originally made by Paris mayor and later president Jacques Chirac.
